data.title: Centerville City Schools
data.meta_description: Learn how Centerville City Schools communicates information to families and community members.
data.text:
District & School Communications

Sharing information helps us build trust with our community, measure our impact, celebrate successes, and learn from our challenges. There are a number of ways you can stay informed!

Parents/Guardians

Centerville City Schools uses ParentSquare for district and school communication. ParentSquare automatically generates an account for each parent/guardian, using the email address and mobile/cell phone number on file in our student information system.

LOG INTO PARENTSQUARE

Updating Your Contact Information

Please review your contact information at the start of each school year when you update your child's Returning Student Data. If your email address or phone number changes during the school year, please contact your child's school office or follow these instructions to update your contact information:

Log into the Home Access Center using your parent/guardian account.

Click on the Registration icon.

Scroll down to Contacts and click on the Edit button on the right side of the page.

Save your changes in HAC. They will automatically update in ParentSquare overnight.

Note: You will only have access to edit your own contact information. Any other parents/guardians will have to log into their own account to edit information.

District/School Newsletters

Parents/guardians of Centerville students will automatically receive a weekly e-newsletter from the district, as well as electronic messages from your child's school and/or teachers.

Emergency Alerts

ParentSquare allows us to contact our school community within minutes. These time-sensitive messages, such as school closures, are sent via email, phone, text, and/or app notifications.

Community Members

Members of the Centerville-Washington Township community can receive district updates through ParentSquare, our mass communication platform. Announcements are delivered by email, and you can choose which groups are relevant to you, including a weekly district e-newsletter and information about community activities. Use the link below to see what groups are available.
